intro: Canthium ramosii, commonly known as the hairy spurge or red spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Canthium ramosii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and woodland edges.
